1   package org.infinispan.configuration.cache;
2   
3   import static org.infinispan.configuration.cache.LockingConfiguration.*;
4   
5   import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
6   
7   import org.infinispan.commons.CacheConfigurationException;
8   import org.infinispan.commons.configuration.Builder;
9   import org.infinispan.commons.configuration.attributes.Attribute;
10  import org.infinispan.commons.configuration.attributes.AttributeSet;
11  import org.infinispan.configuration.global.GlobalConfiguration;
12  import org.infinispan.transaction.LockingMode;
13  import org.infinispan.util.concurrent.IsolationLevel;
14  import org.infinispan.util.logging.Log;
15  import org.infinispan.util.logging.LogFactory;
16  
17  /**
18   * Defines the local, in-VM locking and concurrency characteristics of the cache.
19   *
20   * @author pmuir
21   *
22   */
23  public class LockingConfigurationBuilder extends AbstractConfigurationChildBuilder implements Builder<LockingConfiguration> {
24  
25     private static final Log log = LogFactory.getLog(LockingConfigurationBuilder.class);
26  
27     private final AttributeSet attributes;
28  
29     protected LockingConfigurationBuilder(ConfigurationBuilder builder) {
30        super(builder);
31        attributes = LockingConfiguration.attributeDefinitionSet();
32     }
33  
34     /**
35      * Concurrency level for lock containers. Adjust this value according to the number of concurrent
36      * threads interacting with Infinispan. Similar to the concurrencyLevel tuning parameter seen in
37      * the JDK's ConcurrentHashMap.
38      */
39     public LockingConfigurationBuilder concurrencyLevel(int i) {
40        attributes.attribute(CONCURRENCY_LEVEL).set(i);
41        return this;
42     }
43  
44     /**
45      * Cache isolation level. Infinispan only supports READ_COMMITTED or REPEATABLE_READ isolation
46      * levels. See <a href=
47      * 'http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isolation_level'>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isolation_level</a
48      * > for a discussion on isolation levels.
49      */
50     public LockingConfigurationBuilder isolationLevel(IsolationLevel isolationLevel) {
51        attributes.attribute(ISOLATION_LEVEL).set(isolationLevel);
52        return this;
53     }
54  
55     /**
56      * @see org.infinispan.configuration.cache.LockingConfiguration#supportsConcurrentUpdates()
57      * @deprecated
58      */
59     @Deprecated
60     public LockingConfigurationBuilder supportsConcurrentUpdates(boolean itDoes) {
61        if (!itDoes) {
62           log.warnConcurrentUpdateSupportCannotBeConfigured();
63        }
64        return this;
65     }
66  
67     /**
68      * Maximum time to attempt a particular lock acquisition
69      */
70     public LockingConfigurationBuilder lockAcquisitionTimeout(long l) {
71        attributes.attribute(LOCK_ACQUISITION_TIMEOUT).set(l);
72        return this;
73     }
74  
75     /**
76      * Maximum time to attempt a particular lock acquisition
77      */
78     public LockingConfigurationBuilder lockAcquisitionTimeout(long l, TimeUnit unit) {
79        return lockAcquisitionTimeout(unit.toMillis(l));
80     }
81  
82     /**
83      * If true, a pool of shared locks is maintained for all entries that need to be locked.
84      * Otherwise, a lock is created per entry in the cache. Lock striping helps control memory
85      * footprint but may reduce concurrency in the system.
86      */
87     public LockingConfigurationBuilder useLockStriping(boolean b) {
88        attributes.attribute(USE_LOCK_STRIPING).set(b);
89        return this;
90     }
91  
92     /**
93      * This setting is only applicable in the case of REPEATABLE_READ. When write skew check is set
94      * to false, if the writer at commit time discovers that the working entry and the underlying
95      * entry have different versions, the working entry will overwrite the underlying entry. If true,
96      * such version conflict - known as a write-skew - will throw an Exception.
97      */
98     public LockingConfigurationBuilder writeSkewCheck(boolean b) {
99        attributes.attribute(WRITE_SKEW_CHECK).set(b);
100       return this;
101    }
102 
103    @Override
104    public void validate() {
105       if (attributes.attribute(WRITE_SKEW_CHECK).get()) {
106          if (attributes.attribute(ISOLATION_LEVEL).get() != IsolationLevel.REPEATABLE_READ)
107             throw new CacheConfigurationException("Write-skew checking only allowed with REPEATABLE_READ isolation level for cache");
108          if (transaction().lockingMode() != LockingMode.OPTIMISTIC)
109             throw new CacheConfigurationException("Write-skew checking only allowed with OPTIMISTIC transactions");
110          if (!versioning().enabled() || versioning().scheme()!= VersioningScheme.SIMPLE)
111             throw new CacheConfigurationException(
112                   "Write-skew checking requires versioning to be enabled and versioning scheme 'SIMPLE' to be configured");
113          if (clustering().cacheMode() != CacheMode.DIST_SYNC && clustering().cacheMode() != CacheMode.REPL_SYNC
114                && clustering().cacheMode() != CacheMode.LOCAL)
115             throw new CacheConfigurationException("Write-skew checking is only supported in REPL_SYNC, DIST_SYNC and LOCAL modes.  "
116                   + clustering().cacheMode() + " cannot be used with write-skew checking");
117       }
118 
119       Attribute<IsolationLevel> isolationLevel = attributes.attribute(ISOLATION_LEVEL);
120       if (getBuilder().clustering().cacheMode().isClustered() && isolationLevel.get() == IsolationLevel.NONE)
121          isolationLevel.set(IsolationLevel.READ_COMMITTED);
122 
123       if (isolationLevel.get() == IsolationLevel.READ_UNCOMMITTED)
124          isolationLevel.set(IsolationLevel.READ_COMMITTED);
125 
126       if (isolationLevel.get() == IsolationLevel.SERIALIZABLE)
127          isolationLevel.set(IsolationLevel.REPEATABLE_READ);
128    }
129 
130    @Override
131    public void validate(GlobalConfiguration globalConfig) {
132    }
133 
134    @Override
135    public LockingConfiguration create() {
136       return new LockingConfiguration(attributes.protect());
137    }
138 
139    @Override
140    public LockingConfigurationBuilder read(LockingConfiguration template) {
141       this.attributes.read(template.attributes());
142       return this;
143    }
144 
145    @Override
146    public String toString() {
147       return this.getClass().getSimpleName() + "[" + attributes + "]";
148    }
149 }
